p: The examined plant extracts showed inhibitory activities against acetylcholinesterase (AChE) as well as butyrylcholinesterase (BChE). The highest AChE and BChE inhibition were observed in crude methanol extract of B. pacumbis as an IC 50 value of 31.52 ± 0.58 μg/mL and 11.69 ± 0.14 μg/mL respectively followed by crude ethyl acetate and water extract (Table 2). The crude ethyl acetate and water extract also possessed the greater inhibitory potential of these enzymes compared with standard drug, Galantamine (Fig. 2 C&D).
